result.execSummary:
All charges against Marcus N Longino in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus N Longino is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus N Longino

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from PH Hrg on 7/7/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State filed a setover request on 6/21, which was denied by this court. State gives argument for a set over. Atty Gonzalez objects to a set over. Court makes findings and dismisses this case without prejudice.
Setover Request- ADA Lee***THIS REQUEST IS DENIED PER JUDGE CONWAY** ALL PARTIES ARE TO APPEAR AS SCHEDULED**
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

04:29 PM  Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez. Attorney Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Lennon requests setover in cases 22CF708 and 22CF413 due to officers being unavailable; explanation provided; this is State's 1st request for setover.  Atty Gonzalez objects with argument; requests signature bond or dismissal without prejudice.  Court grants State's request for setover; PH will be scheduled in 3 wks (Atty Gonzalez not avail in 2 wks).  State should not request/receive any add'l setovers.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court.  Defendant not in court, in custody.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney has been appointed. Requesting PH be scheduled.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Amended- Atty Jason Gonzalez
Report of Judicial Efforts to Appoint Counsel

ADDRESS INFO for Marcus N Longino
Current: C/o DCJ, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 05-12-2022)
Prior: 4310 Windflower Way, Madison, WI 53711

Defendant Marcus N Longino in court in custody. Prosecuting Atty Colleen Lennon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court finds DE is elligble for SPD appointment but have been unable to obtain counsel for DE. Court to attempt to appoint counsel at county expense, makes findings under Lee that DE's constitutional rights are not violated by failure to appoint counsel by the state.
Status conference on June 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Email correspondence from Secretary to SPD re: appointment of Atty Gonzalez, no response rec'd
Status conference on May 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.
DE does not have counsel. SPD still needs to appoint. Court set status in 2 weeks.

Request to Appoint Atty Gonzalez as Counsel- DE
Status conference on April 28, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Defendant in court, in custody and without counsel.  Robin W. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court set status for SPD to appoint.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 11:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

03:31 PM   Prosecuting Atty Colleen Lennon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marcus N Longino in court, in custody.  Court notes that Atty Vera withdrew from DE's cases due to conflict; SPD is working to reappoint counsel.  Discn on record regarding time limits; Court finds good cause to set matter over for further proceedings.
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
SPD unable to appoint as of 3/21/22
Preliminary hearing on March 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:31 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  William Leroy Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Crystal Vera made motion to withdraw. Court granted.   Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
